Tracing Coffee Origins

20 Oct 2025

Impacts: social, environmental

Category: remy, tuti, bOO

Tags:

Layout 2 For a primary SCSS/SASS file (like a main.scss or style.scss that will eventually become a full CSS file) that you want Jekyll to render to a .css file, you must include the front matter, but it can be empty.

If you’d like, I can show you a simple structure that combines your universal styles.css and your Jekyll overrides cleanly inside the _sass pipeline (so you maintain just one style system). Would you like that setup example?
